DataElement.preferredName: Maximum Total Serum Bilirubin Laboratory Procedure Performed Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of maximum total serum bilirubin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Maximum Total Serum Bilirubin Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The largest possible quantity or degree._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._A dark orange, yellow pigment that is the product of the breakdown of iron in the blood; it is conjugated in the liver and excreted in the bile._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Maximum Total Serum Bilirubin Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:A bile pigment that is a degradation product of HEME.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
A dark orange, yellow pigment that is the product of the breakdown of iron in the blood; it is conjugated in the liver and excreted in the bile.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
